research_goal.title: Light-Activated Drug Delivery Systems for Precision Medicine
research_goal.description: Develop novel light-activated drug delivery systems integrating optogenetics, nanoparticle engineering, and pharmacology. Hypotheses should bridge: (1) optical control mechanisms from neurobiology, (2) nanoparticle design from materials science, (3) drug binding and release from pharmaceutical chemistry, (4) clinical applicability considerations. Target indication: localized cancer therapy.
constraints: Must integrate optics + nanoparticles + chemistry + medicine

hypotheses.title: Hypothesis 1 (Literature-based): Trans-Disciplinary/Bioengineering Mechanism

hypotheses.mechanism: Building on current understanding of Trans-disciplinary/Bioengineering, this mechanism suggests that the key pathway involves cross-disciplinary integration of molecular and systems-level effects.
testable_predictions: Prediction 1: Observable effect in Trans-disciplinary/Bioengineering context
grounding_evidence: Wang et al. (2023) - Supporting pathway analysis
